title: Sploosh-o-matic
paragraphs: The Sploosh-o-matic is a main weapon in the Splatoon series, made by the weapon brand Neo.
This weapon is a fast-firing, short-range, low-accuracy shooter.
Similar to the Splash-o-matic, it has a steampunk-style look. However, the Sploosh-o-matic has a large metallic funnel attached to the muzzle like the flared muzzle of a blunderbuss.
The Sploosh-o-matic was released on 8 July 2015 at  02:00 UTC.[1]
It comes in a set with Squid Beakons and the Killer Wail.

The Sploosh-o-matic returns in Splatoon 2. It was released on 5 August 2017 at  02:00 UTC.[3] It comes with Curling Bombs and Splashdown.
It appears in three Octo Expansion Stations:
- E05 Hypercolor Station
- F04 C05 Stamped-Up Station
- G09 B05 Wack 8-Ball Station

The Sploosh-o-matic returns in Splatoon 3. Its kit consists of Curling Bombs and the Ultra Stamp.
Its design was changed in the update preceding the release of Fresh Season 2023, with the formerly silver parts of the design now being black. This is reflected in the in-game artwork, as well.
It appears in five missions in Return of the Mammalians:
- 0404 Splash the Block Party
- 0503 Uh-Oh! Too Many Snipers!
- 0505 A Compulsive Collector's Paradise
- 0513 Learn to Reflect, and This One Is in the Bank
- 0607 That Sinking Feeling

- In Splatoon 3, the icons for the Sploosh-o-matic were made darker in version 3.0.0, likely to make it more uniform with the Neo Sploosh-o-matic's icons.
Sploosh-o-matic is derived from sploosh, a word similar to "splash", and automatic. The -o-matic suffix is also a common, clichéd naming convention for technological gadgets.

ボールドマーカー bōrudo mākā is in reference to the partly pen-based appearance of the Sploosh-o-matic. The name is also to contrast it with the Splash-o-matic. The highly accurate Splash-o-matic is named after a sharp marker pen, while the Sploosh-o-matic with its wide, cone-shaped muzzle is more akin to a bold marker pen.
